pages.title: Spectrum Enchanting
pages.text: Using the Enchanter to enchant items is fairly easy:\Place [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Books[#]() onto the [Item Bowls](book://decoration/item_bowl) and the item you want to enchant on the Enchanter itself.\\Unlike regular enchanting, this will not consume the books - but will require a far greater amount of experience in exchange.
Finally supply a steady stream of experience via [Knowledge Gem](book://magical_items/knowledge_gem) and you are set.

pages.title: Copy Enchanted Books
pages.text: You can also use this mechanism to create new [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Books[#](). Just put the [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Book(s)[#]() you want to copy in the [Item Bowls](book://decoration/item_bowl) and a [#](bb00bb)simple book[#]() onto the [Enchanter](book://enchanting/enchanter).\\Because of the mundane nature of the books this will require lots of experience, though.

pages.title: Required Experience
pages.text: You estimate a value **between 50 and 200 experience in most cases per enchantment**.\Other factors affect this, too: like how rare the enchantment is, it's level and how well the target item can absorb enchantments.\Interferences, such as enchantments that are not suitable for your target, further increase this cost.
